steps.title: Ensure Safety and Assess the Situation
steps.description: Make sure the area is safe for both the rescuer and the victim. Check if the person can cough, speak, or breathe.

steps.title: Encourage Coughing
steps.description: If the victim is able, encourage them to cough forcefully to dislodge the object.

steps.title: Back Blows (for severe airway blockage)
steps.description: Stand behind the victim and deliver 5 firm back blows between the shoulder blades using the heel of your hand.

steps.title: Abdominal Thrusts / Heimlich Maneuver
steps.description: If the object is not expelled, perform 5 abdominal thrusts: Stand behind the victim, wrap your arms around the waist, make a fist above the navel, and pull sharply inward and upward.

steps.title: Alternate Back Blows and Abdominal Thrusts
steps.description: Repeat the cycle of 5 back blows and 5 abdominal thrusts until the object is expelled or the victim becomes unconscious.

steps.title: Call for Emergency Help
steps.description: If choking persists, call for professional medical assistance immediately.

steps.title: If the Victim Becomes Unconscious
steps.description: Begin CPR while checking the mouth for the object each time before rescue breaths.
